summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney El (likely Elie Honig) and attorney William Callahan regarding the Epstein investigation. Callahan indicates he expects to engage in discussions with a 'Subject' or his representative in 3-4 weeks, while the AUSA states they cannot discuss hypothetical representations but are open to communication if Callahan represents someone with information.

persons.name: William Callahan
persons.role: Attorney At Law, President of Unitel
persons.context: Attorney who emailed an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein matter, indicating he expects to engage with a 'Subject' or his representative in 3-4 weeks.

connections.description: Email exchange regarding the Epstein investigation, with Callahan updating on potential engagement with a subject and the AUSA responding about communication protocols.

events.title: Telephone conference between Callahan and AUSA
events.description: William Callahan and Assistant U.S. Attorney El had a telephone conference discussing the Epstein matter, referenced in Callahan's follow-up email.

keyFacts: Attorney William Callahan indicated he expected to engage in discussions with a 'Subject' or his representative in the Epstein matter within 3-4 weeks.
Assistant U.S. Attorney El stated the prosecution could not discuss 'hypothetical representations' but was open to communication if Callahan represented someone with information.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative outreach and legal maneuvering in the Epstein case as of December 2019.
William Callahan's signature block notes his former employment at the U.S. Department of Justice and membership in intelligence and legal associations.
